display.label: Zoho
display.description: Manage records, users, and more in your Zoho CRM and Books apps

inputs.comments: Choose the region where your Zoho data center is located. Your authorize URL, token URL and revoke URL regions should all match.
inputs.label: Token URL

inputs.comments: Space separated OAuth 2.0 permission scopes for the Zoho API. Can combine Zoho CRM and Zoho Books scopes.
inputs.default: ZohoCRM.coql.READ ZohoCRM.notifications.ALL ZohoCRM.users.ALL ZohoCRM.org.ALL ZohoCRM.settings.ALL ZohoCRM.modules.ALL ZohoCRM.bulk.ALL ZohoBooks.fullaccess.all
inputs.label: Scopes

inputs.comments: Client Identifier of your app for the Zoho API
inputs.label: Client ID

inputs.comments: Client Secret of your app for the Zoho API
inputs.label: Client Secret

documentation.description:
To make API requests of Zoho CRM or Zoho Books on behalf of your customers you need to create a Client using the [Zoho Developer Console](https://api-console.zoho.com/).

- Log in to the [Zoho Developer Console](https://api-console.zoho.com/)
- Click **ADD CLIENT**
- Choose `Server-based Applications` as the type of client
- Fill out the Client Name and Homepage URL fields with the relevant details
- Add `https://oauth2.prismatic.io/callback` under **Authorized Redirect URIs**
- Note the Client ID and Client Secret values, as these will be important when using the Zoho Connection as part of your Integration

For more information please see the [Zoho documentation](https://www.zoho.com/crm/developer/docs/api/v3/register-client.html) for creating a new Client.

### Zoho in Multiple Regions

Zoho has data centers in the United States, Europe, India, Australia and Japan.
If you develop an integration for users in a single region, you can set your authorize and token URLs to their specific region.
If you plan to deploy your integration to users in multiple regions, be sure that your app is set up to support multiple data centers.
Then, configure your connection's **Authorize URL**, **Token URL** and and **Refresh Token Revoke URL** to be visible to customer deployers, so they can update those values to the region they use.

<Screenshot
  filename="components/zoho/visible-customer-deployer.png"
  maxWidth="500px"
/>

display.label: CRM - Raw Request
display.description: Send Raw Request to Zoho CRM

inputs.comments: This is the URL to call.
inputs.label: URL

inputs.comments: The HTTP method to use.
inputs.label: Method

inputs.comments: The HTTP body payload to send to the URL.
inputs.label: Data

inputs.comments: The Form Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: Form Data

inputs.comments: File Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: File Data

inputs.comments: A list of query parameters to send with the request. This is the portion at the end of the URL similar to ?key1=value1&key2=value2.
inputs.label: Query Parameter

inputs.comments: A list of headers to send with the request.
inputs.label: Header

inputs.comments: The type of data you expect in the response. You can request json, text, or binary data.
inputs.label: Response Type

inputs.comments: The maximum time that a client will await a response to its request
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Enabling this flag will log out the current request.
inputs.label: Debug Request

inputs.comments: The delay in milliseconds between retries.
inputs.label: Retry Delay (ms)

inputs.comments: If true, retries on all erroneous responses regardless of type.
inputs.label: Retry On All Errors

inputs.comments: The maximum number of retries to attempt.
inputs.label: Max Retry Count

inputs.comments: Specifies whether to use a pre-defined exponential backoff strategy for retries.
inputs.label: Use Exponential Backoff

documentation.description:
[Zoho CRM](https://www.zoho.com/crm/) acts as a single repository to bring your sales, marketing, and customer support activities together, and streamline your process, policy, and people in one platform.
[Zoho Books](https://www.zoho.com/books/) is your one-stop platform for managing your accounting tasks and organizing your transactions. It's a single secure location to keep up with your company's bills and invoices, reconcile your bank statements, control your spending, oversee projects, and eliminate sales tax compliance worries.
